page.title: 08ECOLOGY
page.content: Most of the wildlife in this area is attracted by either the crops produced or the vast spectrum of wild plant colours.{Crows}are found in large numbers around the cultivated areas whereas{Sparrows, Starlings and Robins can be found near to communication links. Along the roadside verges the plant life attracts large numbers of insects. The most common species are {Hoverflies, Ladybirds, bees and wasps. Early in spring time the increasing warmth encourages{caterpillar {chrysalli}to hatch into many varieties of moths and butterflies. At the present time many{Red Admiral {butterflies}inhabit the area. Apart from insects small animals can be found in the area such as; {squirrels,rabbits and hedgehogs.
